title: Revealing Picoscale Incommensurate Modulations in a Multiferroic by Electron Ptychography
content: The intriguing functionalities and interplay between multiple degrees of freedom have brought ferroelectric materials as highly promising for applications in next-generation low-power and non-volatile logic devices [1]. Among these, bismuth ferrite (BiFeO3) stands out as the archetypal multiferroic material with coexisting ferroelectric polarization antiferromagnetism at room temperature, renders a promising candidate in next-generation device applications. Furthermore, the rich varieties of near-ground states can be stabilized in BiFeO3 by tuning the electrostatic, elastic, or octahedral tilting boundary conditions, including the VHC phase in (BiFeO3)/(TbScO3) heterostructures which exhibits dipolar wave patterns [2, 3]. However, the detailed atomic structures of the newly identified VHC phase are yet to be fully understood.
